description.narrative: 20,000 people to be reached through HIV Behaviour Change project (Community Conversations on HIV and HIV Radio message campaign) by end 2015

comment.narrative: At the end of 2015 approximately 11,000 people had been reached through Community Conversations on HIV
Approximately 10,000 people reached with correct information on HIV and AIDS through Community Conversations on HIV being supported in HIV ‘Hot Spots’ and via 3 radio stations in Somalia

745 (F: 581, M: 164) people participated in Community Conversation sessions on HIV, . In Q2 HIV radio massages broadcasted through local radio stations in the three zones (Radio Hargaisa, Radio SBC, Radio Mogadish, Radio Baidoa and Radio Garowe), the number of HIV massages aired were 1,362 massages., The overall listenership of these radios is estimated to be between 3 to 5 million people in FL, Somaliland and Puntland,
Continuation of 2015 target

Total: 236 In Puntland 25 judges participated in 3 days of HIV and AIDS sensitization training. In Somaliland, 68 police officers received HIV and AIDS training. In SL UNDP’s Gender project provided information on HIV to 143 people (M:32 and W: 111) in Berbera under their Community Conversations initiative.

comment.narrative: Judicial staff are too few, especially women and are lacking in qualification. Somalis, especially women, remain unequal before the law. Legal traininng, including judge's training, is available throughout Somalia. Bar associations are in place in SOuth Central, Somaliland and Puntland. No UNDP supported legal clinics in South Central, but legal aid centres run by NGOs exist in some cases. 1 legal clinic in Somaliland and 1 legal aid centre in Puntland. Poor awareness of human rights and mechanisms for redress.

description.narrative: Number of Land Use Policies and implementation roadmaps developed that support sustainable Natural Resources Management

comment.narrative: Land use policies and proper enforcement mechanisms on land-use do not exist in all zones of Somalia. This has led to conflicts over natural resources and exacerbated tensions between grazing nomadic pastoralists and sedentary agro-pastoralists. Rural populations are also using land in an ad-hoc manner, cutting trees to produce charcoal and encroaching on grazing lands.
A Land Use Policy in each zone (Somaliland, Puntland and South Central) is initiated

1.1. 1 Land Tenure Report and 1 Land Use Baseline Report finalised. 2. Puntland’s regional disaster management strategy under formulation as part of the Letter of Agreement with Government of Puntland. Climate Change Vulnerability Assessment Report of Pastoral Communities conducted in pilot districts of Puntland. Regional strategies to feed into the National Strategy. 3. Somalia covered under Regional Climate Change Strategy for the IGAD member states. Regional Strategy to provide the basis for the National Climate Change Strategy for Somalia to be finalised during 2016

1. One Land Use Policy for at least one zone developed. 2. A gender-sensitive climate compatible National Development Plan (2017-19) finalised 3. At least 300 women trained in adaptation technologies as a foundation for starting sustainable technology marketing enterprises 4. One Project board meeting held.

1. At the national level, Somalia is covered under Regional Climate Change Strategy for the member states of Intergovernmental Agency for Development (IGAD) with support from the UNDP/GEF/LDCF Project. IGAD Regional Climate Change Strategy sets the framework for the National Climate Change Policy for Somalia being formulated by the UNDP/GEF/LDCF Project. The national land policy draft finalized in Somaliland and its review at regional and district level completed. Puntland Land Policy formulation is still ongoing with MoEWT. 2. National Disaster Management Policy to be initiated after the formulation of National Climate Change Policy which is currently under initiation stage and anticipation is to have it completed by the end of 2017. In addition, 2 existing disaster management policies (Somaliland and Puntland) have been updated while the one for South Central to be part of 2017 LOA with Somali Disaster Management Agency (SoDMA)
3.A total of 280 women (160-Somaliland and 120-Puntland) have been trained on adaptation technologies and benefited upscaling activities i.e. fodder production, reforestation -water harvesting .and small scale business cooperatives.
4. Two project Board Meeting were conducted in October and December 2016 with participants from the Federal Government and regional member States key sector ministries. Key Decisions from the meetings were as follows: a. Project Board Meeting -28th October 2016: • Quarterly Progress Report for the quarter ending 30 September 2016 to be shared with participants of the Project Board Meeting • Mid-term evaluation of the project should focus on whether the investments under this project have brought positive changes to the lives of the people • The impacts of the training and policies should be assessed and any recommendations for future improvements should help in revising the project logic • Project should also look into possibilities of expanding the focus according to new administrative realities in Somali

1. Land Use Policy for at least one zone developed. 2. National Disaster Management Policy developed and at least 2 existing plans/policies are updated to address climate risks. 3. National climate change policy is developed including a fund mobilization strategy to raise public and private financing earmarked for climate change adaptation in all zones. 4. A gender-sensitive climate compatible National Development Plan (2017-19) finalised 5. 4 water conveyance systems and/or boreholes designed and rehabilitated in the four target districts in Galmudug, Hir-shebele and South West with 8 new water diversion/flood routing structures constructed (Sl-5 PL-3) 6. At least 200 ha of forest reforested. 7. 8 Agro-Pastoral Field Schools (APFS) established (2 in each district) with 200 direct beneficiaries per APFS (30% women) 8. One (1) gender-sensitive plan developed by each District Disaster Management Committee to be created (with women representation) in the eight target districts (8 plans total) 9. At least 100 women in the three target zones (SC, SL, PL) trained in adaptation technologies as a foundation for starting sustainable technology marketing enterprises 10. Two Project board meetings held

1. National land policy draft completed in Somaliland. Puntland Land Policy formulation ongoing with MoEWT. At the national level, Somalia is covered under Regional Climate Change Strategy for the member states of Intergovernmental Agency for Development (IGAD) with support from the UNDP/GEF/LDCF Project. IGAD Regional Climate Change Strategy sets the framework for the National Climate Change Policy for Somalia being formulated by the UNDP/GEF/LDCF Project. 2. 0-in process. 3. 0-in process 4. The final NDP draft which was finalised by MoPIC has mainstreamed gender and climate aspects across all pillars. 5. 0-in process 6. 0-in process 7. 0-in process 8. One (1) gender-sensitive plan developed by each District Disaster Management Committee to be created (with women representation) in the eight target districts (8 plans total) 9. A total of 190 women (100-SL, and 90-PL benefited hydroponic fodder production and climate change adaptation trainings respectively as foundation for starting up sustainable technology. 10. 0-in process

comment.narrative:
PIP:
Activity 1: - 2015: While there is large political will, diverging opinions exist and broad-based political and civil agreements have not yet been fully realized. - 2016: Reconciliation process towards state formation has been undertaken in ISWA, GIA and IJA. Hiraan and Middle Shabelle reconciliation process is to be initiated.
Activity 2: - 2015: Establishment Act for the BFC drafted and tabled for parliament’s review and approval. No Commissioners in place; to be appointed after the Act is passed. - 2016: Establishment act for the BFC approved and the commission established.
Activity 3: - 2015: No baseline figures exist on the target population receiving good governance and federalism messages in the IRAs; No conferences conducted in the IRAs on federalism. - 2016: No clear or ad hoc information campaign available on federalism process.
Activity 4: - 2015: Department specifically in charge of federal affairs exists within the Ministry, but with insufficient capacity, and an interim administration does not exist; ad hoc support to MoIFA; MoIFA staff have limited knowledge on federalism and management; ad hoc consultative meetings organized, inclusive of PSG 1 regions. - 2016: Department specifically in charge of federal affairs exists within the Ministry, but with insufficient capacity to facilitate federalism.
Activity 5: - 2015: Short term or ad hoc support available to the emerging states; ad hoc/no training received by the IRAs officials; no office rehabilitated (only in IJA provided by SSF). - 2016: Short term or ad hoc support available to the emerging states. There is no medium term support strategy towards IRAs support.

STEFS Q1 2017 RESULTS: Output 1: a) Hirshabelle interim Administration in Q4 2016, and drafted a charter for the HirShabelle interim administration. b) Five (5) mediation processes were supported, facilitated and led by FMSFGS in Merka, Balanbale, Gedo and Galkayo (with 22.73% women representation). c) 26.01% of state administration staff were trained in conflict management and community problem solving. 42.36% of those trained were Women; (77. 45% with 20.33% Women of GSS staff; 27% with 47.83% Women of JSS staff; and 8% with 58.92% Women of SWS staff) d) Three (3) inclusive consultations on federalism and federal state endorsement criteria took place in Jubbaland and Southwest State. 28.67% of those who participated were women. e) 182 community members/leaders and other citizens were trained in conflict management and community problem solving. 20% of those trained were women.

comment.narrative: 1. Three oversight missions conducted by Somaliland HoR Committees of Discipline, Socials affairs and Public accountss. Regional authorities and services contacted to investigate on security situation (Togdheer Region), enquire on provison of health and education services (Awadal), and the level of transparency and accountability at customs and revenue collection points to investigate (Awadal and Sanaag regions). 2. 640 MPs and their staff trained on developing agenda, parliamentary functions, orders of business etc. 3. A workshop on communication and outreach skills of MPs and constituency office staff 25 (M: 24 F: 1) conducted in Hargeisa. Using the skills gained during the first two days of the workshop, participants developed individual outreach action plans for each constituency office.

1. 768 (M: 610 W:158) MPs and Staff trained on legislative drafting, principles of democracy and democratic society, RoP, public outreach etc. 2. Video and Teleconference equipment provided to NFP and Puntland to improve communication. 3. Construction of security perimeter walls for NFP, Puntland and Somaliland HoRs completed. 4. Development of Somaliland House of Elders (Guurti) Strategic Plan 2016-2021. 5. NFP has completed follow up of ABRIMO recommendations of the third party assessment. 6. The project produced a Parliamentary Regional Offices Manual for Somaliland parliament. 7. NFP legal archiving has been upgraded. 8. Southwest State Assembly received sound system equipment to support parliamentary members to conduct debates effectively.

1. Committees supported to provide oversight of laws and policy. 2. 2 members of Parliamentary leadership supported to develop agendas, order of business, etc. 3. At least 3 activities from communication strategy implemented

1. Capacity of the new MPs 55 (M 53, W 2) from Hirshabelle State Assembly improved, as they are now familiar with the parliamentary practices to perform their constitutional duties including oversight of laws and policy. 2. 2 members of Parliamentary leadership supported to develop agendas, order of business, etc. 3. Parliamentary websites serve as important ways for citizens to learn about their parliament, access to legislation records and communicate with their local MPs. In that regard, UNDP Parliamentary Support Project supported the emerging states to develop websites. So far, Galmudug State Assembly went live last year and Jubaland State Assembly official website went online in February 2017 and it can be accessed at. http://www.jubbalandstateassembly.so/. The other state assemblies are set to go online in Quarter 2.

description.narrative: 2016 1)The extent to which the NIEC's institutional capacity is developed 2) Number of inclusive stakeholder engagement and public outreach programmes planned and implemented, including gender mainstreaming

comment.narrative: The 20122 Federal Parliament was selected through a political process by 135 designated clan Elders. No electoral capacity in place at the Federal Level in Somalia before 2015. (No Electoral Law, NIEC Law approved in Feb 2015; NIEC established in July 2015)

1) An electoral process is held for the election of a new Federal Parliament. 2) The legal framework for universal elections is being developed 3) Institutional capacity of the NIEC is being developed
Quarter 3 2016 1) The NIEC is operational and initial institutional capacity in place 2) Public is informed and stakeholders are engaged in the 2016 process according to plan

1) Key support included developing guiding principles and possible measures to ensure and enhance transparency, minimum quota for female representation in both houses, support to draft codes of conduct, as well as projections with regard to logistical and budgetary requirements. The Electoral Support Joint Programme further assisted the FIEIT with the planning of the electoral budget and funding discussions with donor partners. Together with senior representatives of UNSOM and UNDP, discussions were held at the highest level of the Federal Government of Somalia (FGS) on the budget, the Government’s contribution, and the financial mechanism to collect and manage the candidates’ registration fees. 2) As part of the 2020 Roadmap regarding the preparation of universal elections, the Joint Programme has been discussing with the NIEC and MOIFA how to initiate the first conceptual steps towards the development of the Electoral Law in an inclusive and consultative manner. To facilitate research that will inform the development of a draft Electoral Law, the Joint Programme supported the compilation of a “Compendium of Electoral Legislation of Somalia (1953-1969)” comprising 12 laws in English, including 6 translated from Italian into English, which has been shared with MOIFA. Translation of the Compendium into Somali has commenced to be completed in the next quarter. 3) Strengthening the foundation of the preparations for the 2020 elections, the NIEC recruited in July an ‘acting’ Secretary-General (Chief Electoral Officer), together with the first phase of its Secretariat staff, including national advisors supported by the Joint Programme. In this respect, the Joint Programme provided in August a finance training for the newly recruited NIEC Operations staff, to strengthen their understanding of procurement processes, finance and assets management. The Joint Programme also conducted a session focusing on a capacity development plan for the Secretariat. On 15 August, the Joi

1. The NIEC is operational and initial institutional capacity in place 2. MOIFA takes the lead in coordinating the development of the electoral law 3. Review of the Political Party Law and on the formulation of the electoral lexicon 4. Lexicon is finalized 5. Electoral process concluded as planned and lead to the establishment of a new Federal Parliament

description.narrative: - Office of the focal point for charcoal programme in the Ministry of Livestock, Forest and Range (MOLFRD) strengthened - Number of briefings, workshops, coordination meetings held by the MOLFRD - First meeting of the International Charcoal Trade Regulatory Committee - Draft National and Regional Policy Document - International conference on Somalia Charcoal Reduction Programme held - Awareness raising workshops held in main towns and cities of Somalia - Programme Brochure, website and anti-charcoal campaign started - Funds mobilised from potential donors and development partners for the full-scale joint programme

comment.narrative: - Limited and dispersed capacities in the MOLFR - No capacity development or coordination activities carried out so far - No high-level forum exists to focus on charcoal issues and take policy level decisions - No National or Regional Policy Exist to reduce charcoal production, trade and use - No alliances or partnerships exist to support implementation of the Joint Programme - Low level of understanding on the possible actions to address charcoal issues - Masses are unaware of the Federal Government and UN Joint Efforts to curb charcoal trade and use - Available funds are not sufficient to implement the Joint Programme in its entirety

description.narrative: 1. Number of regions that adopt quota system for women 2. Number of women that contest in national elections supported by UNDP. 3. Number of electoral policies that mainstream gender equality

comment.narrative: 1. No quotas for women in all 3 regions. 2. Data on women candidates for electoral offices at national level not available 3. No gender mainstreamed electoral policies

1. At least one region adopts a Quota 2. 150 Women political aspirants and candidates identified and supported 3. At least one Gender sensitive electoral policy consultations with women’s groups. 3. Gender coordination mechanisms established under the leaderships of the Gender Machineries in South Central, Puntland and Somaliland inter-agency gender coordination mechanism reformulated to strengthen Gender mainstreaming

Somaliland House representatives Law 2005 has been reviewed and included women reserved seats. With the support of professional lawyers, NAGAAD is leading this process and the reviewed draft law is currently being examined by the Quota task force established to coordinate and lobby for the women quota in the parliament
At federal level, A joint UN approach on Gender and constitution review was initiated with an inaugural meeting. The objective of the approach is to provide support to ensure gender equality and women's rights issues (including quota) are adequately addressed in the review exercise. Among the key issues the meeting discussed was the ways the joint UN approach would work in reality. Based on the discussions strategic guidance notes and action plan was drafted.
At Federal level, Women secured eight of 64 assembly seats in the newly formed Galmudug state of the central regions in July.
In Somaliland, 93 women political aspirants identified and trained in leadership and political campaigning in in Somaliland for five days each. NAGAAD has also been undertaking mapping of women political a spirants and candidates organizing consultative forums with Parliamentary Caucus, political parties, women leaders in political parties and youth groups to intensify lobbying and advocacy efforts. A similar exercise is being undertaken by MoWDAFA in Puntland At federal level, following to the approval of the National Independent Electoral Commission (NIEC) law on 11 February 2015, that reserves two seats for women in a nine member commission, a woman was appointed as the chairperson of the NIEC leading high profile commission and technically managing 2016 scheduled election for the time of current Federal Government. NAGAAD organized twelve consultation meetings for the Parliamentary Caucus, political parties, women leaders in political parties and youth groups to intensify lobbying and advocacy efforts toward review of electoral laws to ensure inclusion of women’
1. At least one region adopts a Quota 2. 150 Women political aspirants and candidates identified and supported 3. At least one Gender sensitive electoral policy/law

11 media stories and columns (against the target of 7) were published and featured on Geeska Africa Newsletter and several websites.
This target has also been fully met. 49 (27 from SL 25 PL) young women recipients of UNDP GEWE tertiary scholarship have successfully completed their undergraduate programme.

Quota for women enacted in Somaliland One national conference for agenda setting on women's role in leadership, politics and national development towards 2020 At least one gender sensitive electoral policy in region 60 MPs from national and regional states trained on transformational leadership

National Gender Policy for FGS. GEWE has approved agreement with the MWHRD and hired Gender advisor to support national consultations. In PL, women empowerment policy is being translated into Somali language.
A series of political changes following the election of new government in this quarter delayed the Review of the Provisional Federal Constitution. However, the process of nominating MPs to the constitutional oversight committee is ongoing Sexual Offence bill was approved in PL by the standing committee of parliament in this reporting period. SOB in SL has been tabled to the parliament for discussion and approval. FL SOB is being publicly consulted
